We're the ones who've been here longer. But here's what they didn't know about our landlady. She valued money over everything else, and I'd never been late with rent. Not once. Rachel answered on the second ring and listened to everything. The harassment, the staged incidents, their admission that they'd been manipulating her. Then she said something beautiful. You can leave whenever you want. You only pay for days you're there. Those girls, they'll figure it out. Three days later, Sarah announced they were driving to Vermont for some cousin's baby shower. Second their car turned the corner, I called in every favor I had. My friend with the pickup truck, my coworker with the van, even my ex, who still felt guilty about cheating. By noon, I had a moving crew. I took everything that was mine, and I mean everything. The couch I'd bought off Craigslist, the T V. My parents gave me for my birthday, the kitchen table where they loved holding their little tribunals. The IKEA receipt had my name on it. The shower curtain, the bathroom rug, the Wi Fi router. Even the curtain rods I'd installed myself. Six hours of systematic extraction while their stuff sat in neat piles in the center of the now empty living room. I documented everything with photos and video, dropped my keys with Rachel, and blocked them everywhere. They got back Sunday night to find their personal kingdom had become a barren wasteland. Rachel texted me, they're freaking Out saying you stole everything. I told them you only took what was yours. they're realizing they need someone for your room as soon as possible, or they'll have to cover your rent. June is far away when you're paying triple. They never found anyone. Turns out people touring the apartment didn't appreciate getting an earful about their psycho ex roommate who robbed them. Jessica's boyfriend mysteriously couldn't move in. Something about it being too expensive. By day 28, they were scrambling, begging Rachel for an extension. She gave them 24 hours, and when they couldn't come through with the money, she did something beautiful. She called every landlord in the campus area. Rachel ran in those circles, had coffee with them monthly. Difficult tenants, she told them. Manipulative, can't pay rent, drama makers. Last I heard, they're living 40 minutes from campus because every decent place mysteriously just got rented. Whenever they applied, they wanted me to contribute nothing. Which, granted, now they know exactly what nothing looks like.

Took one look at the narrow driveway, the retaining walls, the complete impossibility of towing without property damage. He told her she'd parked on private property and he couldn't ask me to drive under the influence. Then left. I glanced at the calendar visible through my kitchen doorway. Labour Day weekend, three beautiful days stretching ahead. So I went out and informed her I'd be drinking all weekend since it was a holiday, but she could get her car Tuesday when I went back to work. The shriek that came out of her mouth probably woke dogs three blocks away. She mentioned having classes Tuesday, shrugged and threw her own words back at her. That's not my problem. She tried everything. More cops Saturday morning, same result, tow trucks. Took one look and left. Her friends came begging. One mentioned it was Daddy's BMW. Sunday, they got creative and ordered 20 pizzas to my house. I thanked the confused delivery guy, tipped him well, and had pizza for weeks. One guy claimed his dad was a lawyer and another offered me 200 bucks. But I just kept sipping my beer, watching the show from my porch like it was Netflix. By Sunday, word had spread through the neighborhood. Elderly neighbor brought me cookies, said it was about time someone taught these kids a lesson. Groups of college kids would walk by like my driveway was a tourist attraction. The girl's friends kept showing up in shifts like they were running Some kind of hostage negotiation. Tuesday morning, 7 a. M, I looked out my window, there she was, sitting on my front steps and wrinkled clothes, looking like she'd been there all night. We made eye contact as I walked out in my work attire. Her eyes lit up with hope. He actually stood up, probably thinking her nightmare was finally ending. Then the car pulled up. I hopped right in my Uber because I wasn't in the mood to drive that day. The look on her face, pure, crushing defeat. No words needed. She knew exactly what I was doing. I'd won without throwing a punch, without yelling, without breaking a single law. Just a long weekend of malicious compliance. That same evening, I had a date, first one in months, actually. I needed my car for that. So when I got back around midnight, still grinning from what turned out to be the best night I'd had in forever, the BMW was gone. Just tire marks on the concrete and a faint smell of burnt rubber where she must have peeled out. I never found out what happened to her after that and never saw her again. But for the rest of my time in that house, my driveway stayed completely empty. Party nights, football weekends, graduation week, it didn't matter. They still party on my old street every weekend, but that driveway remains untouchable.

My roommates said I contributed nothing to the house, so I showed them what nothing looks like. Sarah and Jessica were sisters who turned our apartment into their personal kingdom and I was the peasant they wanted to exile. They had been there six months before me, which apparently meant they could act like they owned the place. They'd rearrange the living room without asking, implement house rules that somehow only applied to me, and hold whispered conferences in the kitchen that stopped the second I walked in. It started small with passive aggressive postits on everything. Please don't use our cast iron pan appeared one morning even though I brought it from home. Then came kitchen closes at ten PM for those who work early. Funny considering they both bartended until 3:00am. The food situation escalated fast. Devour my groceries and leave the empty containers in the fridge like trophies. Then complain I was taking up too much space with actual food. My almond milk became their smoothie base. My meal prep containers mysteriously empty. By Tuesday, when I started labeling everything, they called a house meeting about how labels were creating a hostile environment. By month 3, they were manufacturing incidents. I come home from a 12 hour shift to find dishes in the sink and Sarah standing there with her phone out documenting the mess I always leave. They created a shared Google DOC titled Household Concerns that read like fiction. My favourite entry leaves excessive hair In shower drain. I have black hair. They're both bottle blonde. The drain was clogged with bleached strands, but sure blame me. They blast music until 4:00am on weekends, then file noise complaints when I ran my coffee grinder at 7. Jessica's boyfriend basically lived there rent free. But when my friend crashed on the couch once after missing the last train, they threatened to call the landlady about unauthorized guests. The breaking point came on a Tuesday. They called another meeting. Sarah sitting at the head of our kitchen table like she was conducting a tribunal while Jessica stood behind her, arms crossed, trying to look intimidating in her Lululemon. We need to talk about your future here, Sarah started, and then Jessica exploded. Sarah literally had to hold her back as she screamed that I was ruining their lives, that I didn't belong in their space. Whole performance felt rehearsed. But then Sarah smiled and dropped the real bomb. We've already talked to Rachel. She agrees you're not a good fit. Your lease won't be renewed in June. She slid her phone across the table showing texts with our landlady. She's giving us final say on roommates going forward. That smirk on her face. They've been planning this for months. While I was trying to make it work, I laughed and told them I talked to Rachel myself. Sarah's smile widened. She's on our side.

My grandpa got arrested for demolishing his own shed, but his response in court left everyone speechless. I'll never forget the day my 78 year old grandpa called me from the county jail. I was in the middle of dinner when my phone lit up with an unknown number. Hey, kiddo, it's your grandpa. I need a favor, he said with that familiar raspy voice that always reminded me of warm Sunday afternoons at his place. Grandpa, where are you calling from? Well, I'm in a bit of a pickle. I'm at the county jail. Need you to come bail me out. I nearly choked on my pasta. Jail? What happened? Apparently, he chuckled. You can't tear down your own shed without a permit. Who knew? The next morning I posted his bail and drove him home. The whole story came out during the ride. Grandpa had been fighting with the new homeowners association for months. They declared his decades old garden shed an eyesore and demanded he either renovate it to their standards or remove it. Those uppity pencil pushes wanted me to paint my shed beige. Beige after 30 years of that good red barn color, he fumed. So I figured if they don't like my shit, I'll just get rid of the darn thing. What grandpa didn't know was that in our town you need a demolition permit even for small structures. A nosy neighbor who happened to be on the HOA board called the police when She saw him taking a sledgehammer to the walls. You should have seen the look on that officer's face. Grandpa laughed. Poor kid couldn't believe he was arresting an old man for tearing down his own shed. The court date arrived faster than expected. I offered to hire a lawyer, but Grandpa refused. Been representing myself for 78 years, not stopping now. The courtroom was mostly empty that Tuesday morning, just a few bored looking people waiting their turn, a stern judge and a young prosecutor who looked fresh out of law school. When they called his case, Grandpa shuffled forward with his cane wearing his best flannel.

An entitled girl parked in my driveway and said it wasn't her problem, so I made it her only problem. For four days, the cops watched me hold a college girl prisoner in my own driveway and told her it was her own fault. My driveway is this narrow concrete cage between stone walls. Once you're in and I park behind you, you're not leaving until I say so. Three years of entitled kids using it as free parking. I impatient. Then some BMW Princess showed up Friday night and gave me the opportunity I didn't know I was waiting for. I came home from work exhausted, ready to collapse, only to find her car crammed up against my garage door. Not just parked Ed in like she'd claimed the deed to my property. The private driveway, no parking sign might as well have been written in Sanskrit. I side parked behind her, effectively sealing her fate, and went inside. Three years of being the understanding neighbor had officially ended. Around 10 p m, someone pounded on my door like they were serving a warrant. I opened it to find a girl in a crop top and baggy jeans, phone in one hand, car keys jangling in the other. No apology, no greeting, just demanding I move my car immediately. The entitlement in her voice made my eye twitch. I pointed out she was parked in my driveway. She actually rolled her eyes and said she needed to leave. Like I was the one inconveniencing her. When I repeated that she parked on my property, she snapped her fingers at me. Actually snapped them like I was her personal valet. I told her I'm in for the night and I'd move it in the morning. Her face twisted into this disgusted expression before she said the four words that sealed her fate that's not my problem. Those words flipped a switch in my brain. Three years of patience, three years of being reasonable, three years of kids will be kids excuses. But dismissing her trespassing as my problem to solve, I watched her storm off, already dialing someone on her phone. Through my window I saw her pacing in my driveway, gesturing wildly. Then the red and blue lights appeared. Perfect. I was ready to play this game. I grabbed a beer from my fridge and walked out to meet the officer, taking a long sip as I approached. The tired looking cop glanced between me, the beer, and the girl who was now shrieking about being trapped. I explained the situation calmly. Private property, her car trespassing, and now I've been drinking, so I couldn't legally move my car. The office

Military police. What excuse for being late was so creative you almost believed it? Private Miller shows up to formation two hours late, soaking wet, covered in MUD, missing his left boot, and carrying what looked like a medieval shield made out of a stop sign. Thinking drugs, alcohol, maybe he got rolled by locals downtown. Standard Friday night disaster. But before I can even start the interrogation, he throws his hands up and goes, I can explain everything, but you're not going to believe it. Kids got my attention. In my eight years as an M P, I've heard everything. D U I. Excuses, family emergency, lies. The classic my alarm didn't go off routine. This better be good. Miller takes a deep breath and launches into the most elaborate story I've ever heard. Claims he woke up at 0 0 500, like always. But when he stepped outside his barracks, he found a note pinned to his door. Handwritten message saying his girlfriend Sarah had been kidnapped by her ex boyfriend, some local guy named Jake, who'd just gotten out of county locka. According to Miller, this Jake character was some kind of survivalist nutcase who lived in the woods outside Clarksville. The note had G P S. Coordinates and a threat if Miller called the police or brought back up Jake would hurt Sarah. Had to come alone, unarmed, before sunrise. Now I'm thinking this is either complete fiction or the dumbest thing any soldier has ever Done. But Miller keeps going. Says he borrowed a buddy's truck, drove out to these coordinates in the middle of nowhere, found an old hunting cabin, Sarah's car parked outside. He approaches the cabin, and this Jake guy comes out with a shotgun. Turns out it's not a kidnapping. It's some twisted challenge. Jake's been planning this for months, ever since Sarah started dating. Miller wants to prove he's the better man through trial by combat. I'm rolling my eyes at this. Sounds like bad reality TV. But Miller pulls out his phone, shows me photos. There's the cabin. There's a crazy looking dude with a shotgun. There's Sarah tied to a chair, looking terrified. Jake had constructed this whole obstacle course in the woods. Rope climbing, MUD crawls, puzzle solving, the works. Winner gets the girl. Loser gets beaten up and left in the forest. Miller had to complete it without calling for help, or Jake would hurt Sarah. The shield. Jake made him craft it from materials he found in the woods. Hence the stop sign he'd apparently rip.

My coach laughed, if you don't like the way I train, you then quit. So I quit. And a year later, he watched me beat his team on national television. I was the best player on our high school basketball team, but Coach Stevens treated me like a bench warmer. Every practice, I'd run extra drills while the rest of the team got water breaks. He publicly mocked my shooting form in front of everyone, calling it garbage mechanics. Meanwhile, his nephew Tyler, who couldn't make a layup to save his life, got my starting position. I kept my mouth shut for months, worked twice as hard as everyone else in practice scrimmages. I was averaging 28 points in actual games, five minutes of playtime if I was lucky. One day after practice, I approached Stevens. Coach, can I ask why I'm not getting more game time? My stats in practice are. He cut me off. You questioning my coaching decisions? No. I just want to understand what I need to improve. He laughed in my face. You want to improve? Stop thinking you're better than you are. Tyler's a team player. You're selfish. Tyler had literally airballed three free throws that practice. I'm working harder than anyone here, I said, trying to stay calm. If you don't like how I run things, quit. He turned and walked away. I stood there for a minute, processing. Then I went to the principal's office the next morning and requested a transfer. My parents supported the decision after I showed them my practice stats versus my game minutes. Riverdale High accepted me two weeks later. Their coach, Martinez, actually watched me play before making judgments. First practice, he pulled me aside. Stevens is an idiot for letting you go, he said. You're starting point guard. The difference was night and day. Martinez taught me spacing, court vision, and how to be a leader. I wasn't just playing basketball anymore. I was learning the game at a complete, completely different level. Within three months, I was averaging 24 points per game. We won our district championship, then regionals. Suddenly, we were headed to the state finals. Our opponent, Stevens team. The week before the game, Stevens gave an interview to the local paper. We've had a solid season despite losing some players to transfers, he said. But we've built a team culture that can't be broken. I sent the article to our group chat. My teammates hyped me up all week. Game day arrived. The gym was packed. I could see Steven's on the opposing bench, pretending not to notice me during warm UPS. Tyler was starting point guard for them. First quarter, I scored 12 points. Tyler had two turnovers and missed both his shots. By half time, we were up by 18. I had 22 points. Stevens called a timeout, and I watched him chewing out his players from across the court. Third quarter, they made a run. Cut it to Eight points. Stevens was screaming, animated, desperate. For a moment, I remembered all those practices where he made me feel worthless. I looked at Coach Martinez. He gave me a nod. Fourth quarter, I went into a different zone. Every shot felt automatic. Pick and roll, pull up three, drive to the basket. The crowd was going insane. With 47 seconds left, we were up by two. Steven's team had the ball. Tyler drove past to their shooting guard, who missed. I grabbed the rebound. 12 seconds left. I dribbled up court. Steven's was screaming for his team to foul me. They
NA

voice_to_text: The water delivery man noticed the girl's hand. He saw that her finger was broken. He took the boy's ice cream quickly ate it, then placed the ice cream stick on the girl's finger. Used the girl's hairband to splint her finger. The man's name was Nick. He asked the girl for payment for the treatment. At that moment, the girl's father arrived and took her away. As they left, Nick reminded the father and daughter to get the finger checked at a hospital. The girl and her father went to the hospital. The doctor saw the girl's hand and said the splint was done very well. The doctor asked the girl to get an examination. Around the corner, the father and daughter ran into Nick again. The girl's father wanted to thank him, but started coughing. Nick noticed something was wrong. He put his hand on the father's chest and began to check. The girl's father pushed him away saying he was fine. But soon after, he started having trouble breathing. At the same time, a highway accident happened. The hospital received many injured patients. The girl saw her father struggling. She wanted to find a doctor to check on him. But all the doctors were busy with the accident victims. No one paid attention to her. Nick watched the scene. A female doctor came over to ask what was going on. She started examining the girl's father, but was called away by another doctor to help out. The Female doctor told a colleague to take the father for tests first. Nick went along with them. In the elevator, the father fainted. Nick and the doctor helped him out of the elevator, laid him on the floor. The doctor went to get emergency tools. Nick placed his hand on the father's chest. He realized the father's heart had stopped beating. The doctor brought a ventilator ready to intubate the patient. Nick asked for a heart check. The doctor had no choice but to begin checking. He finally found a problem with the father's heart. Nick told the doctor to press on the father's chest. A nurse brought in a defibrillator. Nick helped with the resuscitation. The girl's father's heartbeat finally returned, but he needed surgery immediately. The prep for surgery was done, but they couldn't reach the main surgeon. A nurse came over saying if the surgery wasn't done urgently, the father would die. The girl felt very sad. She knew Nick could save her father. She wanted him to perform the surgery. But Nick was not a doctor at this hospital. He prepared to leave. The girl grabbed his hand, took out a coin, put it in his hand. Seeing the girl cry, Nick decided no matter what happens, he would help her.

voice_to_text: The man wrapped his girlfriend's entire body with cash, the same money they had stolen during a robbery. They needed to smuggle it out of the country, and this was the only way to avoid suspicion. Anna disguised herself as a pregnant woman. Inside her swollen belly were bundles of cash. The two arrived at the airport separately. Anna went in first. Seeing police officers everywhere, she tried to stay calm and slowly walked toward the escalator. Halfway up, she turned around and saw her boyfriend, Jack. Her heart sank. He had been stopped. Stopped by security. His passport was being used for the first time, and the officers were questioning him about his travel purpose. Jack hid his nervousness, answered calmly. Anna wanted to go back and help, but she couldn't risk it. Luckily, Jack handled the situation well and passed the inspection. Then came the scariest part, the security check. If they failed here, everything would be over. As Anna walked through the metal detector, the alarm suddenly beeped. Jack's heart started racing. He quickly turned his head away, pretending not to notice Anna remove moved her necklace and went through again. This time it stayed silent. They both passed security. Relief filled their faces as they hurried toward the plane. When their eyes met, they smiled, finally believing their plan had worked.

voice_to_text: She boarded the plane with her daughter. When she woke up, her daughter was gone. She asked the flight attendants, but they said they had never seen her. They even claimed she had boarded the flight alone. There was no record of her daughter's name on the passenger list. She couldn't believe it. She clearly remembered boarding the plane with her daughter and sitting in Seat 26. But the flight attendant told her that Seat 26 had been empty all along. Laura rushed to the seat, hoping to find her daughter's boarding pass. But the child's backpack was gone, too. Panicking, she said her daughter had been abducted. The crew didn't believe her. Laura ran toward the cockpit to ask for the captain's help. She was stopped by Air Marshal Will, who considered her a security threat. With Will's help, Laura was brought before the captain. The captain was shocked after hearing her story. He questioned several flight attendants, but none had seen the girl. Even will, who sat right behind Laura, said he hadn't seen anyone with her. Laura insisted, describing specific parts of the aircraft that hadn't been searched yet. Because she was the designer of this very plane, the captain decided to trust her. He made an announcement over the intercom, asking passengers to assist in a full search. They even checked the electronics bay. The only place left was the cargo hold, too dangerous for a child to enter. After half an hour, there was still No sign of the girl. Laura refused to accept it. She insisted her daughter had been taken and demanded a search of the cargo hold. The captain refused and turned away. He turned off the intercom, switched off the seatbelt sign, and ended the search. Laura confronted him, demanding to know why he had stopped looking. In truth, before the search began, the captain had contacted ground control. Ground staff investigated Laura's background, found that her husband and daughter had both died in a fall. This revealed that Laura had mental health issues. Unable to accept it, she fainted. When she woke up again, she saw something strange a heart drawn on the window, the same one her daughter had made before boarding. It proved her daughter was real, not a hallucination. Determined, Laura went to the lavatory to continue searching. Alone through the air vent, she climbed into the electrical compartment. After some manipulation, the lights across the plane went out, causing panic among passengers. Laura made her way into the cargo hold. She searched frantically, eventually reaching her husband's coffin. Suspecting her daughter might be inside, she entered the security code and opened it, but only her husband's body was there, no daughter. She broke down in tears. At that moment, will appeared. He handcuffed her, saying her actions had forced an emergency landing. Will took her back to the cabin, and passengers applauded him for catching the troublemaker. Laura begged will again, asking him to have the Captain, search one more time. After landing, will agreed and told Sarah to watch over Laura. Then he left. Everyone assumed he had gone to find the captain, but instead, he went to the cargo hold. There, beside Laura's husband's coffin, he retrieved a hidden explosive device. He installed the bomb in the electronics bay. Laura's daughter was lying right there. It turned out will was behind everything all along.

voice_to_text: This man was once the master of the Mafia. Even the toughest gangsters trembled at the mention of his name. But now he worked as a chef in a small restaurant. His hands still moved with the same precision as when he used to handle weapons. He didn't just cook delicious food, he decorated every plate so beautifully that customers were left amazed before even taking a bite. He could even make flowers out of aluminum foil. The presentation of his dishes made people happy before the food even reached their taste buds. Slowly, his small restaurant became the most popular one in the area. He worked hard every day with full honesty and never asked his boss for extra money. Cooking wasn't his only reason for staying there. He had another purpose, too. One day while taking a bath, he slipped on the soap and fell hard. People nearby rushed him to the hospital. When he woke up, he had lost all his memories. He couldn't remember anything, not his name, not his past. Even his clothes and belongings were gone. And he didn't have a single penny to pay the hospital Bill. Then a kind hearted girl named Julie helped him by paying his Bill. As they stepped out of the hospital, Julie asked his age. He opened his wallet, looked at his ID and saw that it said he was 32 years old. Both of them were shocked. He himself couldn't believe it. He went to the Address written on the ID the place was filthy and smelled terrible. Nothing looked familiar. After Julie left, he started cleaning the house, hoping it would trigger some memories. He tried talking to neighbors, but no one opened the door. Suddenly, a gangster showed up and attacked him. But he defeated the thug effortlessly, made him suspicious. Maybe he had some special abilities. When Julie came back to visit, he told her he liked cleaning and was surprisingly skilled with knives. Hearing this, Julie took him to her family's rice cake shop. The shop manager thought he would be useless. But when the man picked up the knife and began working, everyone was stunned by his skill. One day, while the TV was playing an intense fight scene, his own face appeared on the screen. Julie's mother saw it and was shocked. All the girls were impressed, but the man said, that's not me. I'm scared of fights. Everyone assumed it was just someone who looked like him.

voice_to_text: To escape from a giant monster, a little girl quickly hid inside a cucumber. But she had no idea that the very next second the monster was about to eat that same half cucumber. Just then, a kind hearted old giant swiftly grabbed his hand and lied, say this cucumber has gone bad. It's full of worms. Hearing that, the monster got scared that his stomach might get upset, so he threw the cucumber away. Then he angrily picked up a glass of chlorine water from the table and left. Slowly, the girl crawled out of the cucumber, but her entire body was covered in icky juice. The old giant gently picked her up, took her under a large tap and carefully washed her. Then he placed her clothes near the fire to dry. The old giant wanted to send her back to the human world, but it wasn't easy. He was the smallest among all the giants, so the others often bullied him. That's why when all the giants were taking their afternoon nap, he quietly snuck out with the girl. He walked very cautiously, but a watchful giant spotted him and began to harass him. Thankfully, the girl was hidden inside a blanket so no one could see her. She quickly ran and hid inside an old car. Meanwhile, the giant started bullying the old one again, tossing him around as if he were a ball. Then a huge and heavy giant forced him into a truck on A hill nearby, another giant was standing on top of two scrap cars. Before the old giant could realize what was happening, that powerful one shoved the truck, sending it rolling down. Seeing this, the giant on the hill also jumped, aiming to crash into and kill the old one. But he didn't know that the little girl was hiding inside the car to his right. Just as the collision was about to happen, the girl quickly turned the steering wheel and what happened next was hilarious. The old giant survived completely unharmed. Seeing this, all the giants grew frustrated and began pulling at the old one's ears again. Suddenly, it started raining heavily from the clear sky. Since the land of giants was at a very high altitude, lightning strikes were also a danger. Terrified all the giants scattered in every direction, leaving the old one alone. The old giant picked up the girl once more, put on his glasses and set out to return her safely to the human world.

voice_to_text: A woman was waiting for the Metro. She got bored while waiting, so she drank alcohol. She did not know when she fell asleep. When Lisa opened her eyes, she saw that the Metro station was completely empty. Where there was a crowd earlier, there was no one now. She felt something strange. She panicked and ran upstairs quickly. But on reaching there, she saw that all the doors were closed. The doors were locked. Now Lisa understood that all the station staff had left. She got scared because this had never happened to her before. At that very moment, she heard a voice that the last Metro was coming to the platform. Lisa immediately ran downstairs without thinking anything. As soon as the train started moving, she quickly boarded it. But she did not know that a faint shadow had also silently entered the last compartment of the train behind her. Lisa thought that now she would reach home. Then suddenly, the train stopped suddenly. But the strange thing was that the doors did not open. There was no other passenger in the entire train. Lisa fearfully crossed each coach at a time and reached the driver's cabin. But there was no response. Actually, someone had already killed the driver. Before Lisa could understand anything, the power of the entire train went off. Darkness spread everywhere. She saw a faint light coming from the rear coach. She thought that it might be a Metro employee. He went there to Talk to him. But the person in front was not saying anything. Lisa got suspicious. She ran away from there in fear. While running, her foot slipped and she fell. When she got up and looked, she found that the man was a colleague from her office who was always after her. He had followed Lisa to scare her. He wanted to befriend her forcefully. When Lisa refused, he started forcing himself on her. Then suddenly the door of the train opened by itself. A mysterious force pulled the man out. Lisa did not stop for a moment. She started running again, crossing every coach. She hid in the driver's cabin. Just then, a black shadow passed from outside. Lisa kept running from there and reached another station, which was deserted and closed like the first station. Just then, a strange sound came from behind her. She turned back and saw a dog there. As I was forcing him to tell me where my brother was, I noticed a rocket heading straight for us. To dodge it, the leader and I both went down together. The explosion triggered a landslide. To get information about my brother's whereabouts, I shielded the leader with my body. He told me someone called Rhino Man had ordered him to kidnap my brother. Before he could finish, more debris came crashing down. We were buried alive. Two kidnappers came down to check if I was really dead. One of them even posted On TikTok, bragging that he taken down a superhuman, I suddenly appeared behind him and kicked that kidnapper Shank clean through. Meanwhile, my brother had already been brought before the Rhino Man. The Rhino Man was my most formidable enemy. Anyone who made eye contact with him would experience hallucinations. His speed and strength both surpassed mine. He pulled out a plant from his pocket, one that contained toxins. The poisoned darts I used were extracted from this very plant. This plant only grew in specific regions of Siberia. Which meant they knew I had been there. That moment, I was at home playing with my big cat, completely unaware that danger was closing. When I returned home, I found my sister had arrived. She was worried about my safety. Soon enough, the rhino man arrived in Siberia. This time, they brought some kind of high tech weapon. Once hit by it, you'd be plunged into terrifying nightmares. As they passed through a dense jungle, the rhino man's dog started barking wildly. Suddenly, my big cat appeared, killed several of his men, then leaped into the woods. My brother took the chance to escape. The rhino man sent out a squad to chase them down, but they had already entered the traps I set. As the soldiers searched I suddenly appeared. His companions heard the commotion but couldn't see me. The soldiers on the other side also ran into trap and were impaled by wooden stakes. The screams of the last soldier echoed through the entire forest. The rhino man realized something was wrong and immediately ordered the helicopter to bomb the entire forest. All I could do was keep dodging. Although I was agile and evaded many bombs, I was suddenly hit by a poison dart. I instantly became dizzy and disoriented, plunging into a terrible nightmare. I saw countless spiders in the sky and eerie sounds rang in my ears. The foreigner appeared. I tried to fight back, but my head was splitting with pain. I couldn't catch him at all and was beaten back again and again. Fortunately, I found a chance to pin him to the ground, but my next few punches all landed on wooden stakes. Seeing me being played for a fool, the foreigner kicked me away, then drew his gun to kill me. Just then, an arrow shot straight through his head. It was Black Girl, who arrived just in time. But I was barely clinging to life from my battle wounds. Girl pulled out a mysterious potion and made me drink it. I instantly felt power surge through me and snapped awake.

voice_to_text: To save the bus fare, Jack hid his younger sister Elisa in a bamboo basket. As he was about to board the bus, the conductor grabbed the basket and put it in the luggage compartment. Elisa, who was sitting inside the basket, felt something strange. She slowly pulled her head out and saw that it was pitch dark all around. She he got scared. On the other hand, Jack became restless in the bus. He went to the conductor and said, is everything alright in the luggage section? The conductor said casually, luggage is unloaded at every stop. Don't worry. Jack's heart sank. He screamed in fear, there's my sister there, she will suffocate. The driver immediately stopped the bus on the side the conductor ran down. Jack almost cried. When the compartment door was opened, Jack saw Elisa lying unconscious. Thankfully, she was taken out in time. Jack called out to her loudly. Elisa regained consciousness and cried and hugged her brother. Jack hugged her and said, this will never happen again. Please forgive me. But as soon as both of them got back on the bus, the conductor said, now you will have to buy a ticket. Jack got nervous. He said, I don't have money. The conductor started scolding him in front of everyone. Just then, a good man got up from the back seat and quietly took out the money and gave it to him. On the way, the bus stopped at a service station. Jack Asked the conductor, how far is Guangzhou? The conductor said angrily, this bus is going to Changsha, and he immediately got both of them off the bus. A cold wind was blowing outside. Elisa's face had turned blue. Jack made her sit in a corner and started thinking what to do now. Just then, a truck driver's voice came from nearby. He was going to Guangzhou. Jack immediately went to him and asked for help. The driver kept procrastinating at first, but seeing the condition of the children, he agreed. He made both of them sit in the truck. On the way, Jack told that Elisa has a heart disease since childhood and they are going to Guangzhou to find her father so that she can get treatment. Hearing this, the driver's heart melted. He increased the speed of the truck. Before reaching Guangzhou, a woman known to the driver invited them for dinner. The driver initially refused, but stopped on the woman's insistence. When the woman came to know the story of the children while eating, her thinking changed. She took the driver aside and said, my husband and I have been trying to have a child for many years, but it did not happen. If you give us these children, we will also get them treated. The driver kept thinking for a while, then went out. He went to a nearby mall and bought a gift for his wife with the money he got from the woman. But While returning, he saw a woman. She was looking for her lost child. The driver stopped there. He felt ashamed of himself. He looked at the money in his hand and asked himself, where is humanity? Finally, he took the right decision. He drove the truck all night, returned the money to the woman, returned the gift too, and left from there with the children. When they reached Guangzhou in the morning, driver wanted to give some money to Jack for help, but Jack flatly refused. Both the siblings moved forward again. They reached a construction site. They hoped to find their father there.

That made him very happy, and he decided that now he would join the Olympics. Just as he was about to leave home, his mother called him. When she heard that her son wanted to go to the Olympics, she did not stop him. Instead, she gave him a box and said, keep your winning medals in this. But as soon as the boy left, the mother quietly lowered her head in sadness. When he limped to the bus stop, his father was already waiting there. His father took him back home. With time, his legs slowly healed. Now he put all his effort into chasing his dream. He tried many sports, weightlifting, pole vaulting, but every time he failed, the box meant for medals was now filled with broken glasses. One day, while throwing a javelin, he broke the neighbor's window. His father got angry, and in that moment, his dream was shattered. The next day, his father took him to a construction site and said, now you will work as a Mason. But nearby, there was a ski resort. The boy saw a new dream there, to join the Winter Olympics. He put on skis and began training hard. Step by step, he won many competitions and brought home lots of trophies. Twelve years passed. He had grown up, but the dream was still The same, he qualified to join the national team, but one mistake made all his teammates fall. The media spread the news and he was removed from the team. His dream was broken again. With no other way, he started working with his father as a Mason. At home, he took down the posters from the wall and put away his skis. The next day, when he saw ski jumping on TV, his dream came alive again. This time, he packed his things and left home. At the bus stop, his father was standing there once more, but this time he did not stop him. He wished that his son would finally achieve his dream. The boy reached Norway, where he met a good coach. After hearing his story, the coach was deeply moved and started training him. Now, the boy began real training, jump practice, balancing in the air and bending his knees while landing. Finally, the day came when he got to wear the national team uniform. He also carried the iron box his mother had given him at the Olympic stage. He ran on the ramp and flew into the air. This time, his dream came true.

Just then, the girl sees a ball rolling, and at the same time, the boy notices a hoop around the cat's neck. The boy realizes that the real goal is to put the ball inside that hoop without delay. She quickly throws it, but just before the ball goes in, the cat grabs it and throws it back so hard that one player hits the wall and dies. But suddenly, the cat attacks again and starts swallowing everyone it sees. Terrified, the students scream and run around the room. Then the girl notices the ball is close to Her. As soon as she picks it up, she sees a countdown on it. Only three minutes are left. But just then, the cat moves toward her. Understanding the situation, the boy quickly wears a mouse costume, so the cat's attention goes to him. As the cat chases him, the girl manages to escape. To survive, the boy keeps running. Everywhere he he shouts for someone to throw him the ball, but no one dares. Then something strange happens. After wearing the mouse costume, the boy starts hearing strange sounds. Now he can understand everything the cat says. He is surprised to know the cat is not angry at all. She only wants someone to scratch her back so she can sleep peacefully. Knowing this, the boy climbs onto her back and uses a rope tied there to scratch her. Slowly, the cat becomes calm and stops attacking. The boy calls the others for help. The girl also climbs up and joins him. And when the rest of the students see that the cat is truly relaxing, also start scratching her back. After a while, the cat's eyes begin to close. Seeing this, the boy picks up the ball and gets ready to put it in the basket. But suddenly, all the students run toward him. Everyone wants the chance to throw the ball themselves. voice_to_text: A girl came to the office at midnight just to get the keys. But she saw that a red light was blinking on her computer screen. She got suspicious and moved the mouse without thinking. She immediately acted smartly and pretended as if she is shutting down the computer and then left the office. Next day, she reached the office early in the morning. She took out a small panda camera from her bag and placed it near the computer. At that time, one of her friends came there and asked what it was. Girl lied and said, this is my lucky charm. I have kept it to fulfill my wish. Before the shift ended, the girl slightly changed the position of the camera and her suspicion turned out to be absolutely correct. At night, when everyone had left the office, a woman secretly entered the girl's office. He looked around to see if anyone was there. Then he took out a pendrive and inserted it in the computer and entered the password. The computer's lock opened. Then he copied all the design files in the pen drive. Not only this, he also formatted the computer's hard disk to erase the evidence. He thought that he had done all the work silently, but he did not know that his Every move was being recorded in the Panda camera. The woman was actually the sales director of the company, and the girl was the company's jewelry designer. Some time ago, the girl had designed a special ring named chijon. The boss liked this design very much and he praised it a lot. The girl was confident that this ring would definitely be a hit in the market. But a few days later, when she went to the shopping mall, she saw a shocking scene. She saw that the same ring was being sold in the market and people had already bought it. When she asked the shopkeeper, she came to know that it was a limited edition and now the stock is over. The girl was surprised because it was impossible to sell so much in a single day. Then when she saw the company's sales report, she became even more suspicious. The report said that only 10 pieces were sold, while in reality there was a huge demand for it in the market. She went and told this to her boss. The boss immediately went with her to a marketing meeting. There, the girl told that she went to the shops and saw that the Chanel series was sold out on the first day itself, but the report shows very low sales. The sales director clarified that we had done the promotion in traditional ways where mostly older people come. The girl said that our target audience is young People who go to fashionable places. There was an argument between the two teams on this. Then the company's chairman said, let's play a game next month. Both the teams will do marketing in their own way. The one with better sales will win. The sales director thought that the girl will lose, but the girl accepted the challenge courageously. He said, this bet should be a little bigger. The chairman said, okay. If the design team wins, then the sales will have to change its policy. And if sales wins, then the design team will have to take full responsibility for its work. The sales director now decided to defeat the girl. So he secretly deleted her design files too. Because of this, the computer was formatted that night. The next day, when the girl opened the computer in the office, all her files were missing. She was shocked because she had even taken a backup of the files. But she was not afraid because she knew that the camera had recorded everything. Finally, the result of the competition came out. The sales department had made sales worth $10,000. But the design department's sales had reached $15 million. The one who lost had to face demotion. The girl was already prepared for this challenge. But what happened after this shocked everyone.

voice_to_text: The man was tricked by his own friend. His friend convinced him to feed the crocodiles. But the moment he walked to the middle of the wooden bridge, the so called friend quietly pulled it back while he wasn't looking. Now he was stranded on a tiny island, surrounded on all sides by crocodiles closing in. His friend watched coldly without a word, then walked away. It was clear now. He wanted him dead. Panic rushed through the man. He quickly grabbed a chunk of raw meat and tossed it into the water, hoping it would distract the crocs. But there were far too many of them, and the food was nowhere near enough. Suddenly, he spotted one crocodile climbing up onto the shore. His heartbeat spiked. He glanced around frantically. That's when he noticed a small fishing boat tied up near the shore. Instantly, an idea hit him. He pulled out his gold watch, twisted it slightly, and began to spin it. The reflection caught the boat, rocking it loose, slowly dragging it toward him. Relief washed over his face. This could be his way out. But in the next second, his hope collapsed. The front of the boat was still tightly bound to the shore. Meanwhile, one crocodile had reached dangerously close. In a panic, the man threw his very last piece of meat into the water. But now even more crocodiles were gathering. Just when it seemed like he was seconds away from becoming their prey, his Eyes caught something strange behind him. The crocodiles had unknowingly formed into a shape that looked like a bridge. Without thinking twice, the man jumped across their bodies and escaped from the deadly trap.

voice_to_text: Just work as a nanny for six months and you won't have to worry about life afterward. Does a job like this really exist? The answer is yes. Mister Church encountered this opportunity. She refused to eat the meals church prepared and asked her mother to send him away. What Laura didn't know was that her mother had cancer with at most six months left to live. He said that reading these books required registering them as if in a library. Laura ran angrily back to her room. Her mother went in to comfort her and prepared a library card for her. Laura, however, tore up the library card. At dinner, Mister Church served a delicious dish. Laura pretended not to like it. Her mother signaled her to eat quickly. Laura reluctantly took a bite. It was that one bite that made her start looking forward to the meals every day. From that day on, church seemed like a magician, creating exquisite dishes one after another. Laura's resistance completely disappeared. To encourage her to read, her mother often praised the books Mister Church brought. This made Laura curious. About what kind of books could be so captivating. After much hesitation, Laura approached Mister Church and presented the library card. Seeing the repaired card, church couldn't help but laugh. He selected the 3 Musketeers from the bookshelf and recommended it to Laura. Gradually, Laura fell in love with reading. Time flew by and six years passed. Her mother had battled cancer for a full six years. Laura had grown into a beautiful young woman. She was about to graduate from high school. A boy named Owen invited her to the graduation dance. Laura felt flustered and didn't respond immediately. Mister Church had not left. Six years ago, he should have departed, but he chose to stay and supported the household with his limited savings. When he Learned someone had asked Laura to be a dance partner, her mother encouraged her to enjoy the experience of young love. Mister Church also carefully made a dress for her. On the night of the dance, Laura stepped out in a pink dress. Her mother's face lit up with a warm smile. Mister Church wanted to capture this beautiful moment. The mother and daughter invited him to join them. The three of them took the only photo together. Afterward, Mister Church, like a father, opened the door and handed Laura over to Owen. At night, her mother invited Mister Church for a dance, as if to thank him for his years of devotion. The next day after school, Laura saw Mister Church outside. The station, she realized that her mother would no longer pick her up and she would never appear again. Mister Church, like a father, protected her on the way home. At the funeral, everyone comforted Laura, but Mister Church remained silent. It wasn't until late at night that he choked back tears alone in the hallway. He had fulfilled his responsibility, but had also lost his sense of direction. The question remained, would he leave or stay?

voice_to_text: Suddenly, Jimmy's mother started seeing some strange numbers on his head. At first she thought that maybe her eyes were deceiving her, but the real shock came when she went to drop Jimmy to school. Now she started seeing different numbers on each child's head. And the surprising thing was that the number of each child was different from each other. Jimmy's mother thought that maybe all this was her illusion, so she started ignoring these numbers. But then her eyes fell on a boy who had the biggest number ever written on his head. Out of curiosity, she asked Jimmy about that boy. Jimmy told her he is the topper of the school. He studies so much that now his hair has started falling. On hearing this, Jimmy's mother immediately understood everything. In fact, the number she was seeing on the children's heads were the marks of their future college entrance exams. Now when she saw that Jimmy had the lowest marks, she started worrying. She decided that now she would quit her job so that she could help Jimmy in his studies full time. One day while eating, she noticed that as soon as Jimmy ate an egg, his marks increased a little. She was very happy. And the very next day she put a lot of egg based dishes on the table. Slowly, Jimmy's marks started increasing. Seeing this, even the most beautiful girls in the school started paying attention to him. All this motivated Jimmy a Lot now he started working even harder than before. Jimmy's mother now started dreaming that her son would top the high school and she would win 8 lack yuan as a prize. But one day Jimmy's marks got stuck at 5:56. Even after a lot of efforts, there was no increase in them. Mommy got worried and then she noticed that whenever Jimmy plays the guitar, his marks start going down. She decided that now she will destroy Jimmy's guitar. As soon as the guitar was broken, Jimmy's marks started going up again. But now Jimmy had started changing from within. He started living quietly and without saying anything. He cut his hair short himself. His mother started getting worried seeing his condition. She understood that she had put too much pressure on her son. She wanted to get his lost guitar back. So she took him to his favorite restaurant. There she tried to surprise him, returned the guitar, but Jimmy was no longer the same as before. He threw the guitar there and repeated his mother's old words, all these are obstacles in the way of my success. Saying this, he again started studying. Now his mother was regretting her mistake, but it was too late. Her son had now become a child who was immersed in studies. He now thought everything other than books was a waste of time. He tried to explain the same to other children, but then he heard his favorite tune of his. Guitar. He went towards the auditorium while listening to the sound, and what he saw there blew his senses. His old band members were playing the same tune on the same guitar. Jimmy's eyes filled with tears, but still he asked his mother, if I go there, my marks will not go down right. Seeing the happiness of his son, his mother said, don't worry about the marks. Go and play the guitar to your heart's content. As soon as Jimmy went on stage, everyone was surprised. When he went, his numbers did not decrease, but directly reached 1,000.

voice_to_text: While the two sisters were swimming, they saw a shining diamond at the bottom of the pool. On seeing it, both of them got greedy and the elder sister jumped into the water without thinking. She swam quickly and reached the diamond, but the diamond was stuck at the bottom. The younger sister also jumped into the pool to help her, but as soon as they started pulling it out, the younger sister's hair got stuck in the pipe. At that very moment, the manager sitting above, who thought that all the customers had left, pressed the button to close the pool. Slowly, the lid of the pool started closing, but the younger sister was still stuck in the pipe. The elder sister, scared, pulled her hair hard and somehow pulled her out. Both of them tried to swim upwards quickly, but it was too late. By then, the cover of the pool had closed completely. They shouted loudly outside, but their voice did not reach the manager. That day was Friday, and the pool was going to be closed for the next two days. This meant that no one would come there for two days. Now, the most important thing for them was to get out somehow. Both of them tried to push the lid together, but it was very heavy and there was no place to put the feet underneath. They started looking for a weak part here and there. Finally, they saw a small hole in the Lid. The elder sister thought that maybe they would find a way to get out through this, but some tool was needed to enlarge that hole. Then the younger sister tried to get out of the same hole by folding her hands, in which the elder sister was surprised. Then she started looking for some tool and she found a sharp object, but that object was not of much use. The younger sister started giving up now, but the elder sister's attention was still on that diamond. Finally, she took out that diamond. Now she tried to break the lid above the water drainage cover, but that, too, was tightly closed with a screw. When nothing happened, even after a lot of effort, he came back upstairs. It was night now. The water had started getting cold and the elder sister's diabetes was starting to emerge. She started shivering and she needed insulin, which was in the bag upstairs. Meanwhile, the sound of someone's footsteps came from upstairs. A cleaning lady came in. Both the sisters called out loudly for help, but her attention was on their purse. She took the money and went to the control room and turned off all the cameras. And she came back and started asking for the password of the iPhone 14. The sisters thought that maybe she would call the police, so they told the password. Now she also asked for the password of the ATM card. Then the sisters understood that she Had come to rob them. In anger, they scolded her a lot. The cleaning lady got furious and turned off the heater of the pool, due to which the water became even colder. The elder sister, under compulsion, told the ATM card password. She went to withdraw money and returned after about two hours. This time her face was full of anger because there were only 20 rupees in the account. The younger sister told her with folded hands that the elder sister has diabetes, she could die, but she was only interested in money. Then the younger sister called her nearby to seat, and as soon as she bent down, she attacked her forcefully. This made the sweeper more angry and started taking revenge. By now, 10 to 12 hours had passed for both the sisters. The sweeper started the pool cleaning machine, due to which it became like a washing machine. The elder sister fainted. Seeing this, the sweeper turned off the machine and started asking for the diamond. Then she thought that now she should leave them and went towards the control room, but the password had been changed. Out of fear, she ran away. From there. The elder sister's condition was now getting worse. The younger sister made one last attempt. She went down to the drainage and tried to open the lid with her hands. When she did not succeed, she stuck a towel in it and pulled with all her strength finally the lid Opened, she came up and started breaking the cover with an iron plate. After a lot of effort, the cover broke. She brought her sister out and immediately injected her with insulin. Just then, the sweeper returned with a gun because she was afraid that they would complain to the police. The younger sister wept and promised that they would not tell anyone. The sweeper felt pity.

voice_to_text: This boy held his breath underwater for a long time. When he came up, he realized he had stayed under for a full 60 seconds. That made him very happy, and he decided that now he would join the Olympics. Just as he was about to leave home, his mother called him. When she heard that her son wanted to go to the Olympics, she did not stop him. Instead, she gave him a box and said, keep your winning medals in this. But as soon as the boy left, the mother quietly lowered her head in sadness. When he limped to the bus stop, his father was already waiting there. His father took him back home. With time, his leg slowly healed. Now he put all his effort into chasing his dream. He tried many sports, weightlifting, pole vaulting. But every time he failed. The box meant for medals was now filled with broken glasses. One day, while throwing a javelin, he broke the neighbor's window. His father got angry, and in that moment, his dream was shattered. The next day, his father took him to a construction site and said, now you will work as a Mason. But nearby there was a ski resort. The boy saw a new dream there, to join the Winter Olympics. He put on skis and began training hard. Step by step, he won many competitions and brought home lots of trophies. Twelve years passed. He had grown up, but the dream was still The same he qualified to join the national team. But one mistake made all his teammates fall. The media spread the news and he was removed from the team. His dream was broken again. With no other way, he started working with his father as a Mason. At home, he took down the posters from the wall and put away his skis. The next day, when he saw ski jumping on TV, his dream came alive again. This time he packed his things and left home. At the bus stop, his father was standing there once more. But this time he did not stop him. He wished that his son would finally achieve his dream. The boy reached Norway, where he met a good coach. After hearing his story, the coach was deeply moved and started training him. Now the boy began real training. Jump practice, balancing in the air and bending his knees while landing. Finally the day came when he got to wear the national team uniform. He also carried the iron box his mother had given him. At the Olympic stage, he ran on the ramp and flew into the air. This time his dream came true.

voice_to_text: There was an autistic boy named Rohit. He just had to look once at a human body model and he could draw it exactly on a wall. After seeing his talent, even a senior doctor was shocked. But despite such an amazing ability, society never accepted him. They always saw him as useless. But his life took a turn when he was 20 years old. One day, a large hoarding suddenly fell and landed on a small child. Everyone around panicked. Just then, a nearby doctor rushed to help, but Rohit stopped him and said, if you treat him like this, the child might die. At first, the doctor didn't believe him, but then Rohit explained how a child's neck veins are different from an adult's. The doctor paused, then started CPR exactly where Rohit had guided him. After a while, the child started breathing again, but the danger wasn't over yet. A large piece of glass was stuck in the child's stomach. Rohit looked at him and said there's no movement in the left lung and explained that it was a case of tension pneumothorax. He asked the people around for a knife, but no one helped. So he ran to the airport security guards to get one of the seized knives, but they thought he was crazy and chased him away. Left with no choice, Rohit grabbed a knife and ran. Guards immediately started chasing him and caught him. Thankfully, the child's mother arrived just then and explained. Everything to them. That's when they let Rohit go. Rohit then made a one way valve using a pipe and a bottle. He cleaned the knife with alcohol and made a precise cut on the child's stomach without damaging any veins. As soon as he inserted the pipe, the air was released and the child was saved. People recorded the whole incident on their phones and from that moment, Rohit's life began to change. But the story didn't end there. While the child was in the ambulance, Rohit still had a doubt. He said, get an ultrasound done, but the doctor ignored him. At the hospital, Rohit repeated the same request. Once again, he was ignored and thrown out by security. Coincidentally, the media arrived to cover the hospital just then. As the guards got distracted, Rohit rushed into the operation theater and started shouting, do an ultrasound. It could be pericardial effusion. Still, no one listened. But as soon as the surgery began, the child's heartbeat and blood pressure suddenly dropped. That's when the doctor remembered Rohit's words and quickly did an ultrasound. He realized that Rohit was absolutely right and the child's life was saved again. After the surgery, that same doctor came to meet Rohit. From his behavior, the doctor understood that Rohit was autistic. Still, he thanked him. He asked, are you a doctor? Rohit nodded yes. The doctor asked, where do you work? Rohit replied, right here in general surgery. The doctor was shocked. Couldn't Believe that his new assistant, who just saved a child's life, was actually autistic. After thinking for a few seconds, one thought stayed in his mind, a boy like him shouldn't just be a doctor. He should be a hero.

But just when they were about to capture this moment on camera, the camera slipped from their hand. And even after a lot of efforts, they could not catch it. But this incident did not scare them. Rather, she became more excited to see the shark swimming in the sea up close. Then suddenly, the steel rope slipped a little. The elder sister immediately became alert. She immediately asked the younger sister what happened. Then the younger sister said, nothing, maybe the rope slipped a little. But the elder sister did not feel right. I couldn't sleep after that. Couldn't think straight. Lucy had Emily's eyes, her smile. But did she have my anything? I'd spent four years raising her, loving her, fighting for weekend custody. What if she wasn't even mine? The thought made me sick, but I couldn't ignore it. A week later, another visitor. Brandon, Emily's brother. I need to tell you something. He said. I've been carrying this guilt for too long, I. What guilt? Lucy might not be yours. Emily was with Cole when she got pregnant. She never knew for sure who the father was. She just chose you. She chose me? You had the stable job, the house. Cole was broke. She picked the better option. I sat there stunned. I'm sorry, man. I should have told you years ago. The rest of my time in jail was different. I wasn't defeated anymore. I had a mission. When I got out, I went straight to a lawyer. I need a paternity test. I want to sue for fraud if she's not mine. We can do that. We set a court date. Two weeks later, I showed up for the test. Emily was already there with Lucy. She looked furious. Arms crossed. Lucy saw me and ran over, wrapped her little arms around me. That hit me hard. I'd spent years thinking she was my daughter, raising her, loving her. Now I was about to find out if that was even true. Two weeks later, the envelope arrived. I tore it open. 0% I wasn't her father. Just like that, four years of my life felt ripped away. I called my lawyer immediately. I wanna sue Emily for fraud, for emotional damage, for every dollar of child support I paid. We can do that. I'll get the paperwork started. The court date arrived. I walked into the courtroom. My lawyer met me at the door. Emily was already seated, looking put together. But her eyes gave her away. She knew what was coming. The trial started. Emily went first. Claimed she hadn't known who Lucy's father was, that she'd believed it was me. Tried to play the hero for keeping the secret to protect our family. Then my lawyer stood up. He laid it all out. The letter from Brandon, the paternity test, years of child support payments. And there's something else, your honour. My lawyer said Emily's boyfriend Cole is Lucy's biological father. And she's been collecting child support from both of them. The courtroom gasped. Emily's face went white. The judge looked at the paternity test, then at Emily, then at me. Full story linked below on the channel.

He made it sound like a gift, like he was doing us a favor by building up our tolerance to substances that would destroy other people. Natalie seemed to believe every word. She'd swallow her morning handful of pills and smile at dad like he'd just given her a present. I tried to copy her enthusiasm, but something inside me always felt wrong. School was a nightmare. The pills made it hard to focus. Sometimes made my thoughts scattered and slow. Other times, they made me too focused. Like I was hyper aware of every sound in the classroom. Teachers would comment on my behavior, how I'd be sleepy one day and jittery the next. Dad would smooth it over, saying I had medical conditions that required careful medication management. He'd show up to conferences with fake medical documents and charm everyone into believing him. I got good at pretending everything was normal. Got good at lying about why my pupils were sometimes too big or too small. Why I'd shake during tests. Why zone out in class. My best friend Olivia once asked why I took so many bathroom breaks. I told her I had a weak bladder. The truth was, I was going to throw up from whatever new combination dad had given me that morning. By fifth grade, I developed a system for hiding how sick I felt. Smile through the nausea, breathe through the panic act. The room spinning was normal. Natalie started having problems when She turned 14. She'd wake up with nosebleeds that wouldn't stop. Her hands would shake so badly she couldn't hold a pencil. She lost 15 pounds in two months because she couldn't keep food down. Dad's response was to adjust her medication schedule, add new pills to counteract side effects. He called it recalibration. I called it watching my sister slowly fall apart. She'd stumble through the house like a ghost. Her again, taking on this grayish tint. I begged dad to take her to a real doctor, but he said doctors would overreact and try to take us away. He said the system was designed to destroy families like ours, who understood that strength required sacrifice. I was 12 and starting to realize that what dad called vitamins were actually prescription medications stolen from somewhere, bought illegally. I'd seen enough after school specials to know this wasn't normal, wasn't safe. But speaking up meant risking everything, meant risking Dad's anger, which could be terrifying. The night everything changed, Natalie collapsed in the bathroom. I found her on the tile floor, unconscious, foam coming out of her mouth. Her body was jerking and twitching in ways that made my stomach drop. I screamed for dad, who came running and immediately started doing damage control. Instead of calling 9 1 1, he carried her to her bed, propped her up, tried to force water down her throat. I stood in the doorway watching, my hands shaking so badly I could barely Hold my phone! Call an ambulance! I begged. She needs help. She'll be fine, dad said, not looking at me. She just needs to sleep it off. This happens when you're building tolerance. She's not breathing right. I was crying. Now. Please, dad, please call someone. He finally looked at me, and the expression on his face was something I'd never seen before. Full story is linked below or on my channel.

Their pauses, but it sounded ridiculous out loud. She told me to sit in the waiting area. I sat there holding him for maybe 10 minutes, watching that monitor flicker on and off. A pediatrician walked past us, heading to another room. I don't even know why, but I stood up and blocked his path, showed him the monitor screen. He stopped, stared at it, asked how long it had been doing that. I said two hours maybe. His face changed instantly. He called for a nurse and they took Tyler straight back. No, no more waiting area. They did imaging on his throat and chest. When the results came up on the screen, the doctor's jaw literally tensed. It was a button battery, one of those flat silver ones from a remote or a toy, lodged sideways in Tyler's throat and it was leaking. The acid inside had started burning through tissue. The doctor told me if I'd waited another 30 minutes, it could have burned a hole through his esophagus, could have hit major blood vessels. Kids have died from this exact thing, the nurse said. Most parents don't catch it in time because the early symptoms look like a cold or nothing at all. They did emergency surgery to remove it. Tyler was in the O. R. For an hour. I sat in the hallway shaking so hard I couldn't hold the cup of water they gave me, staring at my phone that was now plugged in. And charging. Thinking about how I almost stopped at the gas station to grab a charger first, how I almost waited to see if the monitor thing would fix itself, how close I came to putting him back to bed and checking on him in the morning. Jake got there right as they wheeled Tyler out of recovery. He was fine, groggy and mad about the IV in his arm, but fine. The surgeon said the damage wasn't deep enough to cause permanent problems, but another hour would have been a different story. We went home the next day. I spent that whole week going through every single toy, every remote, every electronic thing in our house, tape shut every battery compartment with heavy duty tape, even the TV remote, even the bathroom scale. Jake thought I was losing it, but he didn't argue. Now I check Tyler's mouth after he plays in any room. I don't care if I look paranoid.
NA

Again and might need to shower before her dance class at 6. I was like, okay, whatever. Then I remembered my shampoo situation. The new bottles had arrived yesterday. I put them in the bathroom that morning and suddenly I'm thinking about Sarah using half my stuff again without even asking. So I got up, walk to the bathroom, grab both bottles and put them in my bedroom closet, left Austin's basic 2 in 1 stuff on the shelf. Sarah showed up around 5:15 p. M. I heard her and Austin talking in the living room. Then she asked if she could shower. Austin said, yeah, obviously. I stayed in my room working. Maybe 10 minutes later, Austin knocked on my door. Hey, do you have conditioner? Sarah can't find any in the bathroom. I looked up from my laptop. She can use your stuff. He gave me this weird look. I only have the 2 in 1. I said, yeah, I know. Austin stepped into my room and closed the door a bit. Did you hide your shampoo? I nodded. She's your guest, not mine. I'm not running a free salon here. He got defensive immediately. Dude, she just needs to wash her hair. You're being weird about this. I stood up Austin. He used $80 worth of my products last weekend without asking. I make half what you make. I can't just keep replacing expensive stuff for random people. He tried to argue that I was overreacting, that It's just shampoo that Sarah didn't mean anything by it. Cut him off, then buy her some. Your guest, your problem. He left my room without saying anything else. I heard him tell Sarah she could use his stuff and she said something like, oh, that's okay. I'll just rinse with water, which felt passive aggressive, but whatever. She left like 20 minutes later. Austin didn't talk to me the rest of the night. This morning, he made coffee and didn't make me a cup like he usually does. We've lived together for three years and this has never been an issue before.
NA

My wife slept with my stepfather thinking she'd inherit his mansion, but she had no idea I already owned it. I'm 38 and just got divorced from my wife of seven years. The reason she was sleeping with my stepdad, Andrew. Yeah, you read that right. My mom raised me as a single parent and gave me everything despite having very little. 10 years ago, she married Andrew when he was in his early fifties. Never understood what she saw in him, but I kept my mouth shut because she seemed happy. My mom died two years ago and left her massive estate to me and her will. But here's the thing, I never told my wife, Celia, about the inheritance. Let me back up. Years before mom died, Celia became obsessed with my mom's mansion. It was this huge property my mom inherited from her uncle, way beyond what I could ever afford. Celia kept pushing me to move into it and have my mom move to our small apartment instead. You're her only son, so that house will be yours anyway. Why wait, she'd say constantly. We thought about it for months. She called me a mama's boy whenever I defended my mom's right to live in her own damn house. The fights got so bad that I finally lied just to shut her up. I told her mom had written her will, leaving everything to Andrew. That ended the mansion talk. Immediately, Celia went cold on the Subject and stopped mentioning it. I thought the lie had worked perfectly. After mom died, I let Andrew continue living in the house. I didn't transfer the deed to my name because the paperwork was expensive. And honestly, he was grieving. He was family technical. Why make him feel like he was living in my property? So I just left it. Best decision I ever made because if I transferred it, Celia would have been entitled to half in the divorce. Things between me and Celia got weird after Mom's funeral. She started working crazy hours at her nail salon, always busy on weekends. We barely spent time together. When I complained, she said I was being needy now that my mom was gone. Then one afternoon last month, I left work early to meet a friend. I was driving through this area far from our house when I saw them, Celia and Andrew, sitting at a roadside cafe. His arm wrapped around her shoulders, her hand resting on his knee. They were leaning close, talking in a.
